results.title: Babar. Babar's Triumph
results.creator_credit: Laura Shepherd, Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Clifford Ross Co and Nelvana
results.brief_description: Two stories: “Babar’s triumph” and “Babar’s choice”. “Babar’s triumph”: Babar faces his greatest challenge when the Hunter returns to threaten his kingdom. He must unite Lord Rataxes and everyone in the jungle to fight the Hunter and repel him once and for all. “Babar’s choice”: Babar’s advisers, Cornelius and Pompadour, jeopardise his relationship with Celeste by insisting that he take the Gorilla King’s daughter to an important palace ball instead of Celeste. Based on the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.

results.title: Babar and Father Christmas
results.brief_description: In this delightful, fully animated tale, King Babar takes a journey in search of the legendary Father Christmas. But lurking along on Babar’s trail is Babar’s arch-enemy, Rataxes the Rhinoceros, who wants all of Santa’s toys for himself. Based on the book by Jean de Brunhoff and narrated by Laurent de Brunhoff. Rated: G

results.title: BabaKiueria = Barbeque area [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Julian Pringle, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Geoffrey Atherden
results.brief_description:
‘BabaKiueria’ takes a satirical look at black-white relations in late twentieth century Australia, with a comic depiction of a racial role reversal. In documentary (or ‘mockumentary’) style, the film’s presenter investigates white lives in the fictitious land of ‘BabaKiueria’ (‘Barbeque Area’), where white people are a minority, living under black laws and suffering from discriminatory practices and attitudes held by the black majority. Written by Geoffrey Atherden (‘Mother and Son’, ‘Grass Roots’), the film was awarded a United Nations Media Peace Prize in 1987.
Stars Michelle Torres, Bob Maza, Kevin Smith, Cecily Polson, Tony Barry.

results.title: BaadAsssss cinema
results.creator_credit: Isaac Julien, Colin MacCabe, Paula Jalfon, Independent Film Channel and Minerva Pictures
results.brief_description: Informative and fun documentary about the origins and meanings of Blaxploitation cinema. A genre that originated with Melvin Van Peebles groundbreaking underground hit “Sweet Sweetback’s Baadasssss song”, blaxploitation refers to the slew of films that followed in its wake, revolving around, and often celebrating African American culture. In this work numerous actors, directors, and other players discuss their participation in Blaxploitation and what the genre meant to them personally, and culturally. Contemporary filmmakers, such as Quentin Tarantino, are interviewed about the influence of the genre upon their work. Interviewees include: Quentin Tarantino, Larry Cohen, Fred Williamson, Pam Grier, Melvin Van Peebles and Samuel L. Jackson.

results.title: Azzel
results.creator_credit: J.-P. Olivier Fougeres, Peter Hollander, Peter McCaw, Guy L. Cote and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Azzel is the name of one of the first schools for nomads opened by the Niger Department of National Education. The film describes the traditional nomadic lifestyle of the Tuareg and the changes brought about in the lives of the children attending the government-run boarding schools.

results.title: Aya
results.creator_credit: Solrun Hoaas, Denise Patience and Goshu Films
results.brief_description: The story of Aya, the Japanese war bride of an Australian serviceman, spans over twenty years from the early fifties to to the mid-seventies. Hoaas’ intention was to question Australian attitudes to Asians and to express, through the character of Aya’s husband Frank, some disturbing contradictions in the Australian male psyche. In her examination of cross-cultural complexities Hoaas is reticent in projecting feelings, adopting a somewhat elliptical approach to dramatising Aya’s relationship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Solrun Hoaas, Denise Patience and Goshu Films

results.title: Avalon
results.creator_credit: Mamoru Oshii, Atsushi Kubo, Bandai Visual Company, Dentsu, Media Factory and Nippon Herald Films
results.brief_description: In a future world, young people, disheartened by their bleak reality, are increasingly becoming addicted to an illegal (and potentially deadly) battle simulation game called Avalon. Ash (Malgorzata Foremniak) is a ruthless “Class A” fighter and reigning queen of the games who suspects a conspiracy at play and decides to face-off the ruthless programmers. Using highly stylized computer graphics, director Mamoru Oshii (Ghost in the shell), presents an exhilarating psychological science-fiction thriller, that, with its dystopian setting, has the hallucinatory logic of a disturbing, if atmospheric, computer game.

results.title: Avalon: the 1992 Australian International Air Show
results.creator_credit: Geoff Tanner, Cathie Scott, Neil Brown, Aerospace Foundation, Airshows Downunder and Apocalypse
results.brief_description: In October 1992 the largest gathering of aircraft in Australia took place at Avalon Airport, Victoria. The five day air show was the biggest ever held in the Southern Hemisphere. A complete range of aircraft operated by the Australian Defence Forces, general aviation aircraft, warbirds, recreational and sport aircraft, airliners, antiques, balloons, radio-controlled models, hang-gliders and helicopters have all been recorded in static or spectacular flying displays on this video. Presented by Jeff Watson.

results.title: Australian Trams in the Sixties. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Reviewing the sights of Australia’s city streets during the swinging ‘60’s brings back all the memories of those wonderful times. This video features Brisbane’s trams from the mid-sixties up until the closure of the system; Flinders and Collins Streets in Melbourne, where we see tramcars; Ballarat, with its mixture of bogie and four wheel cars; Bendigo, for a variety of types including the single truck Birney trams; and the last route to survive in Adelaide’s once extensive system, the Glenelg line.

results.title: Australian trains and tracks
results.brief_description: Jim Downes presents this program which explores the diversity of Australian tracks and trains in the great era of rail transport following World War Two.
